location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 3/14 III Arrival and departure of ships and B.I.S.N. sailings'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.
Foliation: the foliation system in use is the sequence of numbers appearing in the top right hand corner of each page. Foliation anomalies: 2, 2a; 14, 14a; 21, 21a; 43, 43a (folio 43a is unfoliated).

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the arrrival and departure of mail ships and British India Steam Navigation Company Ltd. Steamships for transport of slow mail included the Baralaand the Barjora. One letter describes how the Government of India commandeered deck space for a thousand returning Shia pilgrims stranded at Basra; also the start of a service to and from Japan. Correspondents include the Political Agent, Bahrain; Gray, Mackenzie and Co. Ltd; British India Steam Navigation Company Ltd; Political Resident Persian Gulf; Political Agent, Muscat.

name.namePart: British India Steam Navigation Company Limited
